question.title: trying to reload all maven plugins throws classnotfounderror on intelliJ (chrome OS)
question.body:
apon selecting the "reload all maven projects" option in the maven tools window, it throws this error:

Error: Could not find or load main class org.jetbrains.idea.maven.server.RemoteMavenServer36 Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/intellij/execution/rmi/RemoteServer

I have tried looking for other people with this same issue, but the one thread I found was someone on WSL, (with no solutions posted) I am currently using Chrome OS's linux feature on an acer laptop. Apon checking my .m2 folder, there is no intelliJ folder under .m2/repository/com

is there any way i can get intelliJ to install it or install it manually?

Edit: I am using i believe OpenJDK-24 as my JDK

question_comments.body: Yes, doing that is what causes the error. My installation also has similar issues with the run functionality so i've had to use the command line
Is this what you want to do?
